title: Restrictions of f
text: Are there any restrictions to the domain for the function $$f(x)=\sqrt{2x+1}$$?
choices: Cannot take the square root of negatives
Can only take the square root of positives

subHints.title: Bounds of the Square Root
subHints.text: For some a, $$\sqrt{a}$$ if and only if a $$\geq$$ $$0$$.

title: Restrictions of f
text: If the bound itself should be included as a valid answer of 'x', meaning it can be equal to that value, then a bracket ("[" or "]") should be used. Otherwise, use a paranthesis ("(" or ")").

subHints.title: Infinity in Interval Notation

title: Restrictions of $$f+g$$
text: Since g does not have any restrictions, the domain will be represented by the restrictions of f.
speech: Since g does not have any restrictions, the domain will be represented by the restrictions of f.
